column4: hi, when dist-upgrading to dapper I get the following error:  trying to overwrite `/usr/bin/ofx2qif', which is also in package libofx0c102
dpkg-deb: subprocess paste killed by signal (Broken pipe), Any ideas?
anyone?
I haven't seen that one.
you tried running the upgrade again?  Assuming you can get to the point of retrying.
yes, i also did apt-get -f install, but still no go
try uninstalling the app (the one it says "but is needed by" or "is used by" in the error)
paste that line again, I forgot the exact error.
it's trying to install ubuntu-base, but I just checked a working system and it's not there
trying to overwrite `/usr/bin/ofx2qif', which is also in package libofx0c102
there ya go
try doing the automatic repair of the package data.  do you know how to do that?
not really
I'm thinking that if you force an uninstall of libofx0c102, it will stop saying that you are trying to overwrite something that you need.
synaptic has it on the menus.
it can't hurt, so it's a good thing to try.
thanks, let me give it a shot
k
it's worth a shot, although I wouldn't give you any odds on it working.
can't do, show the followiThe following packages have unmet dependencies:
sounds like you are making some progress.
backporting to 2.3.2.ds1-20ubuntu15 might work
